ygData.subject: Re: Mesmerize
ygData.msgSnippet: Mesmerize is two things: A shit list wipe and a 15 sec stun. If someone attacks during that 15 secs, then they are now on top of the list. I usually cast
ygData.messageBody:
Mesmerize is two things: A "shit list" wipe and a 15 sec stun. If someone
attacks during that 15 secs, then they are now on top of the list. I usually
cast Tashan, CF and Choke, then Mes to get them pissed at the tank instead
of me. Lull is used to shrink their aggro radius so that you can
theoretically pull only one creature at a time. The problem is that it is
VERY unpredictable as to length, so I use charm instead (in a group) and
have one of them help our group beat the crap out of their buddies, then we
take out the pet when s/he gets pissed.

Djar Lightbringer, Chancellor of HOA (Tarew Marr Server)
Servant of Light, Deliverer of the Truth to Norrath
http://www.hoa-rpg.com/

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Brian Rittermann [mailto:bpr@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 8:03 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Mesmerize
>
>
> From: "Brian Rittermann" <bpr@...>
>
> Mesmerize is different than Lull. Mesmerize stops creatures from
> attacking
> for a second, and is useful in groups when a creature "locks on" to you.
> Back off after you mesmerize and it might start attacking someone else in
> your group.
>
> Lull makes a creature "want" to not attack you. Say there are 4 orcs in a
> camp, and you can only take 1 at a time. Lull three and then lure the
> fourth out of the camp. The others won't follow if lull was
> successful. If
> it was... start running as they all will come running ;)
>
> Loreweaver
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Brewhaus <brewhaus@...>
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
> Date: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 8:26 PM
> Subject: [eqenchanters] Mesmerize
>
>
> >From: Brewhaus <brewhaus@...>
> >
> >Is mesmerize a better Lull spell or is it totally different? I always
> >here people say "Use Lull." I always use mesmerize. Is that bad? If
> >they are different could you explain why? Thanks,
> >
> >Aarreran, Mithaniel Marr
